results.title: From forest to timber yard
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Film opens with a short description, aided by diagrams, of the structure of hard and soft woods followed by a demonstration on the correct way of felling trees, cutting the logs into boards and stacking to dry. The film concludes by listing the woods suitable for different types of work, eg oak and mahogany for cabinet making; pine and fir for carpentry; ash and elm for the wheelwright; and lime and maple for carving.

results.title: Union is strength: the story of plywood
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”
The structure of wood makes it liable to split or be broken along the grain. This film describes how this tendency can be overcome by the construction of plywood.

results.title: Talking metric
results.creator_credit: Peter Riding, Michael Garrod and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Know How Series”
Discusses the change to the metric system in industry, its advantage and opportunities for rationalisation procedure in changeover, training and other aspects.

results.title: Carcase constructions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Using a knife box as an example, this film describes how boards can be joined at the corners. No other credits available.

results.title: Saws
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.
Show correct stance for using saws. Points out main part of a saw, and gives description of the teeth found in various types of saw. From the series “Basic Woodwork”.
